snippet: A surprising subject has erupted in the early weeks of the race for New York City mayor, complete with boldface endorsers, voluble protests and a generously financed attack ad: animal rights.
abstract: Animal rights issues have erupted in the early weeks of the race for New York City mayor, complete with boldface endorsers, voluble protests, and a generously financed attack ad; group of horse lovers is helping to back the first major advertising buy of the 2013 race: a $1 million attack on City Council speaker Christine C Quinn, who has been a longtime target of animal rights advocates because of her support for horse-drawn carriages in Central Park.
lead_paragraph: A surprising subject has erupted in the early weeks of the race for New York City mayor, complete with boldface endorsers, voluble protests and a generously financed attack ad: animal rights.

headline.seo: Animal Rights Becomes Surprise Topic in New York Mayoral Race
headline.main: Early in Mayoral Battle, Carriage Horses Are Drawn Into Race
headline.print_headline: Early in Mayoral Battle, Carriage Horses Are Drawn Into Race
